author: symbil
content: Heya everybody! My name Is Paul (pablosan). I have been doing a lot of reading on eth2 with the intention of becoming a validator. I'm working through the Eth2 Hacker Start information on ethereum.org and hoping to get involved in testing efforts. I'm just doing this in my spare time so my progress may be a bit slow. I'm very excited about everything I'm reading about Casper FFG, PoS, Sharding, etc.

author: protolambda
content: Hey <@296672161811398657>, welcome! Are you interested in development, or just want to learn about all this first? I highly recommend https://hackmd.io/@benjaminion/eth2_info as a place to start learning

author: symbil
content: Hi <@!203220829473996800>! I may be interested in development, but planning to start out just seeing if I can figure out how to get a client (at least the beacon) running locally. Thanks for the link. I've read several of the items in that list (e.g. all of the Ethereum "Validated, staking..." blog entries).

author: symbil
content: I'm now looking at the different clients with a preference for Prysm or Trinity (Python is currently my strongest language, and I also have some Golang experience). I see Prysmatic has their own testnet. Is their testnet only usable with their client? Or maybe a better question, assuming their are multiple testnets: how do I choose one?

author: raulj
content: Hi <@!296672161811398657> Raul from the Prysm team here. You can get started running a node https://prylabs.net/participate. Our testnet is for now, Prysm only, but we will be restarting it soon to match the latest spec version which will be interoperable with other clients.

author: raulj
content: You can also check out our documentation here: https://docs.prylabs.network

author: raulj
content: You can join our discord if you have any questions https://discord.gg/6zQrMeH
